definition: to diverge/to branch off the road/to change (the subject)
fork in road/bifurcation/branch in road, river, mountain range etc/to branch off/to turn off/to diverge/to stray (from the path)/to change the subject/to interrupt/to stagger (times)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: But sometimes DHL they will diverge parcel inspection, then their own packaging.
sentences.chinese: 但有时DHL他们会岔开包裹检查，然后自己包装。

sentences.english: Then you branch off and you have all these special humans.
sentences.chinese: 那么你和你岔开这些特殊的人类。

sentences.english: The road to the coast branches off from the main road in about a mile.
sentences.chinese: 通往海边的路从大路岔开约一英里左右。

sentences.english: The road to the museum turns off here.
sentences.chinese: 去博物馆的路由这儿岔开。

sentences.english: The corrupt officials tried to sidetrack our investigation.
sentences.chinese: 这些贪官污吏企图岔开我们的调查。

sentences.english: He managed to steer the discussion away from the subject of money.
sentences.chinese: 他设法把讨论内容从钱的话题上岔开了。

sentences.english: It's difficult to head her off when she talked about her dissolute life.
sentences.chinese: 要是她谈起她的风流韵事来，你就别想岔开她的话题。

sentences.english: We got side-tracked in our discussion.
sentences.chinese: 我们达到讨论被岔开了。

sentences.english: The road kept descending and branching off, through meadows misty in the twilight.
sentences.chinese: 道路继续下倾，在模糊的草地里岔开两支。

sentences.english: The road and railway line diverge at the bottom of the hill.
sentences.chinese: 公路和铁路线在山脚下岔开了。

sentences.english: I gazed round for a means of diverting her thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 我向四下里呆望着，想办法岔开她的思想。

sentences.english: He stands with his legs wide apart.

definition: interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
to set off/to take to the road
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
